profile.name: Nico Tagliente
profile.bio:
Educated in Vienna and Rome, he began his career in Sweden, where distance and winter light reshaped his sense of sound.

A classical organ concert performer, he has played some of the most beautiful historical organs in the world — instruments that still carry centuries of breath and architecture. Early music, from ancient modes to Renaissance and Baroque counterpoint, is approached as a present act of listening.

Alongside this, he performs with Ableton Push. Electronics are not a rupture, but a continuation. Voltage becomes breath. Code becomes counterpoint.

From ancient Greece to digital sequencing, his work traces a single anthropological continuum: one culture, unfolding across time.

Only the instrument changes. The human impulse — to shape air into meaning — remains.
